stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds a new ice-castle stage (Course 13), applies recent bug/performance fixes, demos anti-aliasing and infinite draw distance on real N64 hardware, and briefly pauses to co-host the F3 fangame showcase.
level: Cowboy level with infinite draw distance

development_findings.summary: Nearly all items on the bug/performance to-do list were cleared during the past week, including many “minuscule performance tweaks.”
development_findings.quote: I almost finished my to-do list regarding bugs and performance issues.

development_findings.summary: A long-broken warp pipe now functions on real N64 hardware after a recent fix, although the timer inside the sub-area still runs too fast.
development_findings.quote: This pipe works now… It works!… The timer is going way too fast.

development_findings.summary: Toggleable anti-aliasing has been implemented; players can switch it on for smoother visuals or off for sharpness/performance.
development_findings.quote: When you want anti-aliasing, there you go. Now the game is anti-aliased.

development_findings.summary: Kaze created a technique to give some stages (e.g., the Bunny Brush ‘Cowboy’ level) infinite draw distance while holding ~60 FPS on console.
development_findings.quote: This level has infinite drawing distance even on 64… It’s still at 60 FPS sometimes.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 design: a slide leads into a snowman walkway and platforming rooms ending in a treasure chamber. Obstacles were re-aligned and jumps made easier after on-stream testing.
development_findings.quote: These ones should probably be a little more parallel… let's make it easier.

development_findings.summary: Very large areas cause Mario 64’s camera buffer-clearing bug; Kaze may invent a new fix but has not yet pursued it.
development_findings.quote: I might have to invent a solution to that problem. Right now I'm not really worrying about it.

development_findings.summary: Game size target is < 64 MB even with new tech (anti-aliasing, extended draw distance, etc.).
development_findings.quote: Nope, it’s going to be under 64 megabytes.

development_findings.summary: Audio: currently MIDI or wav imports; Kaze hopes future OPUS or LibDragon compression will allow shipping the full OST without size bloat.
development_findings.quote: Even OPUS-compressed songs would be too big… I still hope that one day… we can just put a whole hack OST on it.

development_findings.summary: Real-hardware testing pipeline is streamlined: one button export + capture card yields instant console testing, despite added controller lag.
development_findings.quote: All I have to do… is hit this button… turn on my N64… and now we are on the real N64.

development_findings.summary: Only two full stages remain once Course 13 is finished; Kaze aims to complete the current level within a month.
development_findings.quote: I hope I can finish this level in the next month or so and then it's just two levels missing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze became a father five days prior; daughter is named Reyna. Zeina’s mother currently helps, reducing his workload.
context_findings.quote: Yes, the baby came out five days ago… honestly, it doesn't feel like that much, although it's probably a lot more work for Zeina than for me.

context_findings.summary: He views ROM hacks as freer and more creative than commercial games because they don’t need to sell.
context_findings.quote: When you have to sell well, you have to make something somewhat bland… ROM hacks can get a little more creative.

context_findings.summary: Art philosophy: design for emotional effect rather than textbook principles; distrusts creating ‘for critics.’
context_findings.quote: If you operate on principles, you make art for critics, you don't make art for the sake of it being experienced.

context_findings.summary: Prefers to hide level previews inside technical dev videos to avoid spoilers while assuring fans of progress.
context_findings.quote: Whenever I make a preview, it's like ‘Look how I used this new feature on the N64 to make this level.’ Works well enough.

context_findings.summary: Legal stance: can’t sell cartridges, but plans to release a collector’s box+booklet (no Nintendo IP) and let third parties handle unofficial carts.
context_findings.quote: I am not allowed to sell real cartridges… but I am planning to do is make a box and a book inlet… cartridges will be illegally manufactured by other people.

biobak.summary: Designed the updated Fuzzy enemies now wearing protective gear for the factory level.
biobak.quote: This was Biobak's idea and Biobak made the model.

biobak.summary: Planned rework of the Koop(a) Carnival stage is on Biobak’s task list.
biobak.quote: Is Biobak going to rework Cooper Carnival? I hope so. That is the plan anyway.

badub.summary: New music tracks for the Bowser office and elevator exist but are not yet hooked up in-game.

zeina.summary: Active in chat, recently gave birth; personal support role acknowledged by Kaze.
zeina.quote: Zeina's mom is helping us and honestly, it doesn't feel like that much, although it's probably a lot more work for Zeina than for me.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Broken Pipe
key_stories.summary: A warp pipe that never worked on console finally functions after a recent code patch, demonstrating Kaze’s rapid hardware test loop.
key_stories.challenge: Old warp pipe crashed or failed only on real N64.
key_stories.process: Implemented fix, exported build, hot-swapped to console during stream.
key_stories.outcome: Pipe now works; discovered secondary timer-speed bug to address next.
key_stories.key_quote: It works! Oh my god, I got Giga-killed.

key_stories.title: Infinite Draw Distance Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze showcases a level where geometry and enemies are visible across the map without pop-in while keeping near-60 FPS.
key_stories.challenge: N64’s severe render-distance limits traditionally cause heavy pop-in.
key_stories.process: Custom rendering tweaks and culling rules; live console demo.
key_stories.outcome: Feature stable; will be used in multiple stages.
key_stories.key_quote: This level has infinite drawing distance even on 64… still at 60 FPS sometimes.

key_stories.title: Designing Course 13’s Snow-Fortress
key_stories.summary: Live iteration turns an awkward, difficult path into smoother platforming and sets up a treasure room finale.
key_stories.challenge: Wall-kick section felt ‘awkward’ and camera misbehaved in huge space.
key_stories.process: Real-time geometry edits, narrowing scale, making walls parallel, lengthening run-ups.
key_stories.outcome: Platforming flow approved; visual polish pending offline work.
key_stories.key_quote: Let's make it easier… So that the camera issue doesn't pop up.
